text: Effects of prostaglandin E2 on Th0-type human T cell clones : modulation of functions of nuclear proteins involved in cytokine production .
The effects of prostaglandin E2 ( PGE2 ) on cytokine production and proliferation of the <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + human helper T cell clone SP-B21 were investigated .
In cells stimulated with anti-CD3 mAb , PGE2 inhibited cell proliferation and the production of all the cytokines examined .

Addition of rIL-2 fully restored the proliferative response and partially restored the production of <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but not that of other cytokines .

text: In contrast , in cells stimulated with phorbol myristate acetate ( PMA ) / A23187 , PGE2 enhanced the production of <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and only partially inhibited the production of other cytokines .

text: Therefore , the effects of PGE2 vary depending on the mode of T cell activation , and the <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are regulated differently from other cytokines .

text: In a mobility shift assay , only the NF-kappa B ( <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) homodimer was observed in a complex formed with the kappa B sequence in unstimulated SP-B21 cells .

When cells were stimulated with anti-CD3 mAb or PMA / A23187 , a complex formation of NF-kappa B ( <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) heterodimer with the kappa B sequence was induced .

text: Interestingly , PGE2 or di-butyryl ( Bt2 ) cAMP abolished the binding of NF-kappa B ( <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) heterodimer to the kappa B sequence in cells stimulated with anti-CD3 mAb but not with PMA / A23187 .

text: Our results suggest that the target of PGE2 action is a component in the signal transduction pathway leading to the activation of protein kinase C . However , the inhibition of the T cell activation signals by PGE2 is selective .
PGE2 enhanced the complex formation with NF-AT , AP-1 and CLE0 sequences when the cells were activated by either anti-CD3 mAb or PMA / A23187 stimulation .
It seems therefore that PGE2 , by elevating cAMP levels , interferes with the activation pathway for NF-kappa B but not for NF-AT , AP-1 or CLE0 binding protein .
